Key Match Events: Michael Harris II made a jaw-dropping home run robbery in the seventh inning, which was considered one of the best catches by both the Braves and Phillies.
Max Fried allowed solo homers to Edmundo Sosa and Trea Turner.
Post-Match Reflections: Philadelphia manager Rob Thomson praised Harris' catch as one of the best ever seen in the game.
Atlanta manager Brian Snitker called it the 'catch of the year' and mentioned they would be watching it for the next 24 hours.
Michael Harris II expressed his satisfaction with making the catch, noting it was a dream come true.
Max Fried tipped his hat to Harris for the special play, calling it the best catch he ever had behind him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Braves starting pitchers have allowed three runs or fewer in 20 straight games, extending their longest single-season streak since 1893.
The Braves have fallen six games behind the first-place Phillies in the National League East.
